title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The NFL unveiled media deals that people familiar with the matter said are valued at over $100 billion, providing a windfall for the league and significantly expanding the availability of games on streaming platforms.

---

U.S. stocks fell amid another selloff in the government bond market. The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow lost 3%, 1.5% and 0.5%, respectively.

---

Goldman is talking to JetBlue about taking over the airline's credit-card program from Barclays, which is seeking to hold on to its deal.

---

Chubb has made a preliminary proposal to acquire rival insurer Hartford Financial Services.

---

Initial jobless claims rose last week to 770,000, still elevated above the pre-pandemic peak of 695,000, but have dropped since January.

---

Google said it would spend $7 billion this year on expanding its footprint of offices and data centers in the U.S.

---

FedEx reported that profit nearly tripled and revenue jumped 23% in the company's latest quarter.

---

NASA's plans for a lunar mission this year remain on track after it said a deep-space rocket made by Boeing passed a key engine test.

---

Leslie Wexner and his wife, Abigail Wexner, won't stand for re-election to L Brands' board, the company said.

---

The former co-chiefs of bankrupt lab-testing startup uBiome were charged with healthcare and securities fraud, among other offenses.
